Section 5.1 · Multi-Agent

Role Taxonomy of Multi-Agent Systems

Figure 8: Generic Roles and Domain Adaptations

Generic Roles:

  • Leader/Coordinator
  • Worker/Executor
  • Critic/Evaluator
  • Memory Keeper
  • Communication Facilitator

Domain-Specific Adaptations: Software Engineering, Finance, Legal Activities, Education, Healthcare, Biomedicine, Music

5.1.1 Generic Roles

Leader/Coordinator: The leader is responsible for maintaining high-level coherence within the system. This role involves setting global objectives, decomposing tasks into manageable subgoals, and assigning them to appropriate agents. The leader arbitrates conflicts that emerge between agents with overlapping or contradictory outputs.

Worker/Executor: Executors are the operational backbone of MAS. They engage in concrete actions such as invoking external tools, writing or executing code, retrieving documents, or interfacing with the environment.

Critic/Evaluator: This role centers on quality assurance, verifying correctness, testing hypotheses, red-teaming responses, and surfacing potential risks.

Analysis & Explanation

Role Design Principles

Practical Guidance

Effective multi-agent systems mirror human organizations: clear responsibilities, communication channels, and accountability. The Leader-Worker-Critic pattern maps directly to Manager-Developer-QA in software teams.
